alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 11:11AM CDT until April 19 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Snake River At Mora affecting Kanabec County. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Wright, Sherburne and Stearns Counties. Chippewa River at Eau Claire affecting Eau Claire County. Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Pepin and Dunn Counties. .Flooding from the recent snowmelt will continue to flow through the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Highway 10 on the north approach to the bridge across the Chippewa River may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Thursday, the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1000 AM CDT Thursday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 04/19/1982. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
